ca.eandb.jmist.math

Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.eandb.jmist.math.Circle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class Circle
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A circle in two dimensional space (the set of points at most a constant distance from a fixed point). This class is immutable.
    Author:
    Brad Kimmel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Circle EMPTY
      An empty circle.
      static Circle UNIT
      The unit circle (the circle centered at the origin with a radius of 1.0).
      static Circle UNIVERSE
      A circle containing all points.

    • Constructor Summary

      Initializes the center and radius of the circle.

        radius - The radius of the circle (must be non-negative).

        Determines if this circle is empty.

        A value indicating if this circle is empty.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Point2 p)
        Determines if this circle contains the specified point.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to check for containment of.
        Returns:
        A value indicating if p is within this circle.

        public Circle expand(double amount)
        Expands this circle outwards by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to expand the circle by.
        Returns:
        The expanded circle.

      • expandTo

        public Circle expandTo(Point2 p)
        Expands this circle outwards to encompass the specified point. Guarantees that this.contains(p) after this method is called.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to include in this circle.
        Returns:
        The expanded circle.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Ray2 ray)
        Determines whether the specified ray intersects with this circle. Equivalent to !this.intersect(ray).isEmpty().
        Parameters:
        ray - The ray to test for an intersection with.
        Returns:
        A value indicating whether the ray intersects this circle.
        See Also:
        intersect(Ray2), Interval.isEmpty()

      • intersect

        public Interval intersect(Ray2 ray)
        Computes the intersection of this circle with the given ray.
        Parameters:
        ray - The ray to compute the intersection of this circle with.
        Returns:
        The interval in which the ray passes through the circle (i.e., this.contains(ray.pointAt(x)) if and only if this.intersect(ray).contains(x)).
        See Also:
        contains(Point2), Ray2.pointAt(double), Interval.contains(double)

      • nearBoundary

        public boolean nearBoundary(Point2 p)
        Determines whether the specified point is near the boundary of the circle.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to consider.
        Returns:
        A value indicating whether the specified point is near the boundary of the circle.

      • nearBoundary

        public boolean nearBoundary(Point2 p,
                            double epsilon)
        Determines whether the specified point is near the boundary of the circle, within a specified tolerance.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to consider.
        epsilon - The tolerance.
        Returns:
        A value indicating whether the specified point is near the boundary of the circle.

      • normalAt

        public Vector2 normalAt(Point2 p)
        Computes the normal at the specified point, assuming p is on the boundary of the circle. This method is guaranteed to return a unit vector.
        Parameters:
        p - The point at which to compute the normal.
        Returns:
        The normal at the specified point.

      • smallestContaining

        public static Circle smallestContaining(Iterable<Point2> points)
        Computes the smallest Circle containing each of the given points.
        Parameters:
        points - The collection of points for which to compute the smallest Circle containing those points.
        Returns:
        The smallest Circle containing the given points.

      • boundingBox

        public Box2 boundingBox()
        Gets the smallest Box2 containing this Circle.
        Returns:
        The smallest Box2 containing this Circle.
